conclusion: Analyze forces and equilibrium conditions before and after changing mass of object C.
Initial setup: Mass of A = 2m, Mass of B = 3m, Mass of C = m, Spring constant = k.
Object A is connected to object B via a spring, and object C is connected to A via a rope over a pulley.
Forces on A: Gravitational force = 2mg, Tension in rope = T1, Spring force = kx1.
Forces on C: Gravitational force = mg, Tension in rope = T1.
Equilibrium condition for A: T1 = 2mg - kx1.
Equilibrium condition for C: T1 = mg.
Equating tensions: 2mg - kx1 = mg implies kx1 = mg implies x1 = mg/k.
Change in mass of C: New mass of C = 5m.
Forces on A with new mass of C: Gravitational force = 2mg, Tension in rope = T2, Spring force = kx2.
Forces on C with new mass: Gravitational force = 5mg, Tension in rope = T2.
Equilibrium condition for A with new mass: T2 = 2mg - kx2.
Equilibrium condition for C with new mass: T2 = 5mg.
Equating tensions with new mass: 2mg - kx2 = 5mg implies kx2 = -3mg implies x2 = -3mg/k.
Change in height of A: Delta x = x1 - x2 = mg/k + 3mg/k = 4mg/k.
Final answer: Height that object A rises is 4mg/k.
